instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 820-000281 - Need Touch Bar connector
threads.message:
Hi. I don't have a donor board and can't seem to find any online anywhere. But I need the connector for connecting the Touch Bar display to MLB. Anybody know where to find either a donor board or the connector itself ?? Preferably a donor so I could beep my way to where to bridge the burned pins as I also cannot find schematics for this shit...

Thanks

threads.title: 820-000281 - Need Touch Bar connector
threads.message: I'm pretty sure they are the same as iPad Air 2 rear camera connector. I guess you need the matching connector on the flat cable too as that will be fried too.

threads.title: 820-000281 - Need Touch Bar connector
threads.message:
No Title

Thanks. The rear camera connector from an iPad Air fits :-)

But where does the burned pin go ?

threads.title: 820-000281 - Need Touch Bar connector
threads.message: Look at <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> diagram, it goes to <RESISTOR>R5630</RESISTOR>. So you need to find the current sense resistor for this line.

threads.title: 820-000281 - Need Touch Bar connector
threads.message:
I already beeped me through to the other side of the board via the via and the computer is now working

Thanks Duke. Words cannot explain how much i love you :-)
